ContentClassification.TableReference: National Association of Insurance Commissioners, "1985 NAIC Cancer Claim Cost Tables", Proceedings of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners, Vol. I. (Kansas City, Mo. 1986)
ContentClassification.TableName: 1985 NAIC Cancer Claim Cost Tables for Radiation and Chemotherapy - Male
ContentClassification.TableDescription: 1985 National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) Cancer Claim Cost Tables - Male. Basis: Radiation and Chemotherapy Benefits Under Standard Plans. Minimum Attained Age: 15. Maximum Attained Age: 99
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Based on lives insured under cancer expense policies. Claim information includes payments during 1978 and 1979. It is believed 80% of all applicable experience is included in the study. Claim costs that are separated by gender are: hospitalization, surgery, anesthesia, drugs, radiation and chemotherapy, and attending physicians. Claim costs not split by gender are blood and plasma, nursing care and ambulance services. A Standard Plan is defined as having the following: (1) $50 per day for first 7 days then $30 per day, (2) $500 scheduled maximum for surgery, (3) actual expense up to $70 per operation ($30 for skin cancer), (4) 10% of hospital benefit max for medications, (5) actual expense for radiotherapy and chemotherapy with $1,000 lifetime maximum, (6) actual expense up to $300 lifetime maximum for blood and plasma except no maximum for leukemia, (7) private duty nursing care at $24 per hospital day with $600 lifetime maximum, (8) attending physician while in hospital at $10 per day with $600 lifetime maximum, and (9) ambulance services at actual expenses subject to $500 lifetime maximum. Methodology: Tables loaded at a uniform 5% (applied to the incidence rate elements) plus a small amount believed to be 1-2% with regard to the continuance element. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 12/2012.

MetaData.TableDescription: 1985 National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) Cancer Claim Cost Tables - Male. Basis: Radiation and Chemotherapy Benefits Under Standard Plans. Minimum Attained Age: 15. Maximum Attained Age: 99
